Title:Microsoft Windows Server 2016 STIG SCAP Benchmark - NIWC Enhanced with Manual Questions
Description:This Security Technical Implementation Guide is published as a tool to improve the security of Department of Defense (DOD) information systems. The requirements are derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 and related documents. Comments or proposed revisions to this document should be sent via email to the following address: disa.stig_spt@mail.mil.
Notice:Portions of this document were developed at Naval Information Warfare Center Atlantic by employees of the Federal Government in the course of their official duties. Pursuant to title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code this software is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain. The Government assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and the software is provided "AS IS" without warranty or guarantee of any kind, express or implied, including, but not limited to, the warranties of merchantability and of fitness for a particular purpose. In no event shall the Government be liable for any claim, damages or other liability, whether in an action of contract, tort or other dealings in the software. The Government has no obligation hereunder to provide maintenance, support, updates, enhancements, or modifications. We would appreciate acknowledgement if the software is used. This software can be redistributed and/or modified freely provided that any derivative works bear some notice that they are derived from it, and any modified versions bear some notice that they have been modified.
Front-Matter:This content stream was enhanced with OCIL manual questions derived from the STIG Manual by the NIWC SCC team.

Release Info:Enhanced Content 2.4.4 Date: 2023-08-08, based on Release: 2.4 Benchmark Date: 11 May 2023

Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    Automated Checks

    • V-224828 - Systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level. - Pass
    • V-224831 - Local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes. - Pass
    • V-224874 - Windows Server 2016 reversible password encryption must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-224932 - AutoPlay must be turned off for non-volume devices. - Fail
    • V-224933 - The default AutoRun behavior must be configured to prevent AutoRun commands. - Fail
    • V-224934 - AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives. - Pass
    • V-224954 - The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges option must be disabled. - Fail
    • V-224958 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Basic authentication. - Fail
    • V-224961 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not use Basic authentication. - Fail
    • V-225025 - Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network. - Pass
    • V-225044 - Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed. - Pass
    • V-225045 - Anonymous enumeration of Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts must not be allowed. - Pass
    • V-225046 - Anonymous enumeration of shares must not be allowed. - Pass
    • V-225048 - Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted. - Pass
    • V-225053 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent the storage of the LAN Manager hash of passwords. - Pass
    • V-225054 - The LAN Manager authentication level must be set to send NTLMv2 response only and to refuse LM and NTLM. - Pass
    • V-225071 - The Act as part of the operating system user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-225079 - The Debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-225091 - The Create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-224819 - Users with Administrative privileges must have separate accounts for administrative duties and normal operational tasks. - Not Checked
    • V-224821 - Administrative accounts must not be used with applications that access the Internet, such as web browsers, or with potential Internet sources, such as email. - Not Checked
    • V-224829 - The Windows Server 2016 system must use an anti-virus program. - Not Checked
    • V-224964 - Only administrators responsible for the domain controller must have Administrator rights on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-224971 - The Active Directory SYSVOL directory must have the proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-224972 - Active Directory Group Policy objects must have proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-224973 - The Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must have the proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-224974 - Domain-created Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU) objects must have proper access control permissions. - Not Checked
    • V-224978 - Directory data (outside the root DSE) of a non-public directory must be configured to prevent anonymous access. - Not Checked
    • V-224992 - Domain Controller PKI certificates must be issued by the DoD PKI or an approved External Certificate Authority (ECA). - Not Checked
    • V-224993 - PKI certificates associated with user accounts must be issued by the DoD PKI or an approved External Certificate Authority (ECA). - Not Checked
    • V-225007 - Only administrators responsible for the member server or standalone or nondomain-joined system must have Administrator rights on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-225012 - Windows Server 2016 must be running Credential Guard on domain-joined member servers. - Not Checked

Results: Medium Severity (CAT II)

    Automated Checks

    • V-224850 - The Fax Server role must not be installed. - Pass
    • V-224851 - The Microsoft FTP service must not be installed unless required. - Pass
    • V-224852 - The Peer Name Resolution Protocol must not be installed. - Pass
    • V-224853 - Simple TCP/IP Services must not be installed. - Pass
    • V-224854 - The Telnet Client must not be installed. - Fail
    • V-224855 - The TFTP Client must not be installed. - Pass

    • V-224858 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client. - Fail

    • V-224860 - FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons. - Pass
    • V-224866 - Windows 2016 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater. - Pass

    • V-224868 - Windows Server 2016 must have the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset configured to 15 minutes or greater. - Pass
    • V-224869 - Windows Server 2016 password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered. - Pass

    • V-224871 - Windows Server 2016 minimum password age must be configured to at least one day. - Pass

    • V-224920 - Insecure logons to an SMB server must be disabled. - Fail
    • V-224921 - Hardened UNC paths must be defined to require mutual authentication and integrity for at least the \\*\SYSVOL and \\*\NETLOGON shares. - Fail
    • V-224922 - Command line data must be included in process creation events. - Fail
    • V-224923 - Windows Server 2016 virtualization-based security must be enabled with the platform security level configured to Secure Boot or Secure Boot with DMA Protection. - Fail
    • V-224924 - Early Launch Antimalware, Boot-Start Driver Initialization Policy must prevent boot drivers identified as bad. - Pass

    • V-224926 - Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented. - Fail

    • V-224939 - The System event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater. - Fail

    • V-224943 - File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode. - Pass
    • V-224944 - Passwords must not be saved in the Remote Desktop Client. - Fail
    • V-224945 - Local drives must be prevented from sharing with Remote Desktop Session Hosts. - Fail

    • V-224948 - Remote Desktop Services must be configured with the client connection encryption set to High Level. - Fail
    • V-224949 - Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds. - Fail
    • V-224951 - Basic authentication for RSS feeds over HTTP must not be used. - Pass
    • V-224952 - Indexing of encrypted files must be turned off. - Fail
    • V-224953 - Users must be prevented from changing installation options. - Fail
    • V-224955 - Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software. - Pass
    • V-224956 - Automatically signing in the last interactive user after a system-initiated restart must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-224957 - PowerShell script block logging must be enabled. - Fail
    • V-224959 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not allow unencrypted traffic. - Fail
    • V-224960 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) client must not use Digest authentication. - Fail
    • V-224962 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not allow unencrypted traffic. - Fail
    • V-224963 - The Windows Remote Management (WinRM) service must not store RunAs credentials. - Fail
    • V-225008 - Local administrator accounts must have their privileged token filtered to prevent elevated privileges from being used over the network on domain systems. - Fail
    • V-225009 - Local users on domain-joined computers must not be enumerated. - Fail
    • V-225010 - Unauthenticated Remote Procedure Call (RPC) clients must be restricted from connecting to the RPC server. - Fail
    • V-225011 - Caching of logon credentials must be limited. - Pass
    • V-225013 - Remote calls to the Security Account Manager (SAM) must be restricted to Administrators. - Fail
    • V-225014 - The "Access this computer from the network" user right must only be assigned to the Administrators and Authenticated Users groups on member servers. - Fail
    • V-225015 - The "Deny access to this computer from the network" user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and local accounts on domain systems and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-225016 - The "Deny log on as a batch job" user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-225017 - The "Deny log on as a service" user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems. No other groups or accounts must be assigned this right. - Fail
    • V-225018 - The "Deny log on locally" user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts on domain systems and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-225019 - The "Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services" user right on member servers must be configured to prevent access from highly privileged domain accounts and all local accounts on domain systems and from unauthenticated access on all systems. - Fail
    • V-225020 - The "Enable computer and user accounts to be trusted for delegation" user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts on member servers. - Pass

    • V-225023 - The US DoD CCEB Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems. - Fail

    • V-225027 - Windows Server 2016 built-in guest account must be renamed. - Pass

    • V-225029 - The setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-225030 - The setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) must be configured to enabled. - Pass

    • V-225032 - The computer account password must not be prevented from being reset. - Pass
    • V-225033 - The maximum age for machine account passwords must be configured to 30 days or less. - Pass
    • V-225034 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to require a strong session key. - Fail
    • V-225035 - The machine inactivity limit must be set to 15 minutes, locking the system with the screen saver. - Fail
    • V-225036 - The required legal notice must be configured to display before console logon. - Fail

    • V-225039 - The setting Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (always) must be configured to Enabled. - Fail
    • V-225040 - The setting Microsoft network client: Digitally sign communications (if server agrees) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-225041 - Unencrypted passwords must not be sent to third-party Server Message Block (SMB) servers. - Pass
    • V-225042 - The setting Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (always) must be configured to Enabled. - Fail
    • V-225043 - The setting Microsoft network server: Digitally sign communications (if client agrees) must be configured to Enabled. - Pass
    • V-225047 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent anonymous users from having the same permissions as the Everyone group. - Pass
    • V-225049 - Services using Local System that use Negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication must use the computer identity instead of authenticating anonymously. - Fail
    • V-225050 - NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session. - Fail
    • V-225051 - PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented. - Fail
    • V-225052 - Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites. - Fail
    • V-225055 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to at least negotiate signing for LDAP client signing. - Pass
    • V-225056 - Session security for NTLM SSP-based clients must be configured to require NTLMv2 session security and 128-bit encryption. - Fail
    • V-225057 - Session security for NTLM SSP-based servers must be configured to require NTLMv2 session security and 128-bit encryption. - Fail
    • V-225058 - Users must be required to enter a password to access private keys stored on the computer. - Fail
    • V-225059 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to use FIPS-compliant algorithms for encryption, hashing, and signing. - Fail
    • V-225061 - User Account Control approval mode for the built-in Administrator must be enabled. - Fail
    • V-225062 - UIAccess applications must not be allowed to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop. - Pass
    • V-225063 - User Account Control must, at a minimum, prompt administrators for consent on the secure desktop. - Fail
    • V-225064 - User Account Control must automatically deny standard user requests for elevation. - Fail
    • V-225065 - User Account Control must be configured to detect application installations and prompt for elevation. - Pass
    • V-225066 - User Account Control must only elevate UIAccess applications that are installed in secure locations. - Pass
    • V-225067 - User Account Control must run all administrators in Admin Approval Mode, enabling UAC. - Fail
    • V-225068 - User Account Control must virtualize file and registry write failures to per-user locations. - Pass
    • V-225069 - Zone information must be preserved when saving attachments. - Pass
    • V-225070 - The Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-225072 - The Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-225073 - The Back up files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Fail
    • V-225074 - The Create a pagefile user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-225076 - The Create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-225077 - The Create permanent shared objects user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts. - Pass
    • V-225078 - The Create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass

    • V-225081 - The Generate security audits user right must only be assigned to Local Service and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-225082 - The Impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service. - Pass
    • V-225083 - The Increase scheduling priority user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass

    • V-225088 - The Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-225089 - The Profile single process user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Fail
    • V-225092 - The Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Fail
    • V-225093 - The Take ownership of files or other objects user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group. - Pass
    • V-236000 - The Windows Explorer Preview pane must be disabled for Windows Server 2016. - Fail

    Manual Checks

    • V-224820 - Passwords for the built-in Administrator account must be changed at least every 60 days. - Not Checked
    • V-224822 - Members of the Backup Operators group must have separate accounts for backup duties and normal operational tasks. - Not Checked
    • V-224823 - Manually managed application account passwords must be at least 15 characters in length. - Not Checked
    • V-224824 - Manually managed application account passwords must be changed at least annually or when a system administrator with knowledge of the password leaves the organization. - Not Checked
    • V-224825 - Shared user accounts must not be permitted on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-224826 - Windows Server 2016 must employ a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy to allow the execution of authorized software programs. - Not Checked
    • V-224827 - Windows Server 2016 domain-joined systems must have a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) enabled and ready for use. - Not Checked
    • V-224830 - Servers must have a host-based intrusion detection or prevention system. - Not Checked
    • V-224832 - Permissions for the system drive root directory (usually C:\) must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-224833 - Permissions for program file directories must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-224834 - Permissions for the Windows installation directory must conform to minimum requirements. - Not Checked
    • V-224835 - Default permissions for the HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE registry hive must be maintained. - Not Checked
    • V-224837 - Outdated or unused accounts must be removed from the system or disabled. - Not Checked
    • V-224838 - Windows Server 2016 accounts must require passwords. - Not Checked
    • V-224839 - Passwords must be configured to expire. - Not Checked
    • V-224840 - System files must be monitored for unauthorized changes. - Not Checked
    • V-224841 - Non-system-created file shares on a system must limit access to groups that require it. - Not Checked
    • V-224842 - Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows Server 2016. - Not Checked
    • V-224843 - Systems requiring data at rest protections must employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of the information at rest. - Not Checked
    • V-224844 - Protection methods such as TLS, encrypted VPNs, or IPsec must be implemented if the data owner has a strict requirement for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality is maintained at every step of the data transfer and handling process. - Not Checked
    • V-224845 - The roles and features required by the system must be documented. - Not Checked
    • V-224846 - A host-based firewall must be installed and enabled on the system. - Not Checked
    • V-224847 - Windows Server 2016 must employ automated mechanisms to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation using the following frequency: continuously, where Endpoint Security Solution (ESS) is used; 30 days, for any additional internal network scans not covered by ESS; and annually, for external scans by Computer Network Defense Service Provider (CNDSP). - Not Checked
    • V-224848 - Windows Server 2016 must automatically remove or disable temporary user accounts after 72 hours. - Not Checked
    • V-224849 - Windows Server 2016 must automatically remove or disable emergency accounts after the crisis is resolved or within 72 hours. - Not Checked
    • V-224861 - FTP servers must be configured to prevent access to the system drive. - Not Checked
    • V-224863 - Orphaned security identifiers (SIDs) must be removed from user rights on Windows 2016. - Not Checked
    • V-224875 - Audit records must be backed up to a different system or media than the system being audited. - Not Checked
    • V-224876 - Windows Server 2016 must, at a minimum, offload audit records of interconnected systems in real time and offload standalone or nondomain-joined systems weekly. - Not Checked
    • V-224898 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage successes. - Not Checked
    • V-224899 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Object Access - Removable Storage failures. - Not Checked
    • V-224975 - Data files owned by users must be on a different logical partition from the directory server data files. - Not Checked
    • V-224976 - Domain controllers must run on a machine dedicated to that function. - Not Checked
    • V-224977 - Separate, NSA-approved (Type 1) cryptography must be used to protect the directory data in transit for directory service implementations at a classified confidentiality level when replication data traverses a network cleared to a lower level than the data. - Not Checked
    • V-224980 - Active Directory Group Policy objects must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-224981 - The Active Directory Domain object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-224982 - The Active Directory Infrastructure object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-224983 - The Active Directory Domain Controllers Organizational Unit (OU) object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-224984 - The Active Directory AdminSDHolder object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-224985 - The Active Directory RID Manager$ object must be configured with proper audit settings. - Not Checked
    • V-224986 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Computer Account Management successes. - Not Checked
    • V-224991 - Domain controllers must have a PKI server certificate. - Not Checked
    • V-224994 - Active Directory user accounts, including administrators, must be configured to require the use of a Common Access Card (CAC), Personal Identity Verification (PIV)-compliant hardware token, or Alternate Logon Token (ALT) for user authentication. - Not Checked
    • V-225006 - The password for the krbtgt account on a domain must be reset at least every 180 days. - Not Checked

Results: Low Severity (CAT III)

    Automated Checks

    • V-224864 - Secure Boot must be enabled on Windows Server 2016 systems. - Fail
    • V-224865 - Windows 2016 systems must have Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) firmware and be configured to run in UEFI mode, not Legacy BIOS. - Fail
    • V-224916 - Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent IP source routing. - Fail
    • V-224917 - Source routing must be configured to the highest protection level to prevent Internet Protocol (IP) source routing. - Fail
    • V-224918 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to prevent Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) redirects from overriding Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)-generated routes. - Fail
    • V-224919 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to ignore NetBIOS name release requests except from WINS servers. - Fail
    • V-224931 - The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft. - Fail
    • V-224942 - Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled. - Pass
    • V-225060 - The default permissions of global system objects must be strengthened. - Pass

    Manual Checks

    • V-224836 - Non-administrative accounts or groups must only have print permissions on printer shares. - Not Checked
    • V-224862 - The time service must synchronize with an appropriate DoD time source. - Not Checked
    • V-224979 - The directory service must be configured to terminate LDAP-based network connections to the directory server after 5 minutes of inactivity. - Not Checked
    • V-225037 - The Windows dialog box title for the legal banner must be configured with the appropriate text. - Not Checked

Detailed Results: High Severity (CAT I)

    V-224828 - Systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224828r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-00-000110
    Identities:SV-87891
    V-73239
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Systems at unsupported servicing levels will not receive security updates for new vulnerabilities, which leave them subject to exploitation. Systems must be maintained at a servicing level supported by the vendor with new security updates.
    Fix Text:Update the system to a Version 1607 (Build 14393.xxx) or greater.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1020
    Result:true
    Title:Systems must be maintained at a supported servicing level.
    Description:Systems must be maintained at a supported service pack level.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Verifies the OS Major Version is equal to or greater than 10)
      • true (Verifies the OS Build (currentNumber) is equal to or greater than 14393)
      • true (Verifies the OS Release is equal to or greater than 1607)
      • true (Verifies the OS Build (current) is equal to or greater than 14393)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:102000 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Verifies the OS Major Version is equal to or greater than 10
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:102000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name must be equal to 'CurrentMajorVersionNumber'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:102000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '10'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name equals 'CurrentMajorVersionNumber'
    • last_write_time equals '133415425160000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '10'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:102001 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Verifies the OS Build (currentNumber) is equal to or greater than 14393
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:102001 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name must be equal to 'CurrentBuildNumber'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:102001 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_sz'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be greater than or equal to '14393'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion'
    • name equals 'CurrentBuildNumber'

    • type equals 'reg_sz'

    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-224831 - Local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224831r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-00-000150
    Identities:SV-87899
    V-73247
    CCI-000213 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-3.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-3; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-3)
    Description: The ability to set access permissions and auditing is critical to maintaining the security and proper access controls of a system. To support this, volumes must be formatted using a file system that supports NTFS attributes.
    Fix Text:Format volumes to use NTFS or ReFS.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1024
    Result:true
    Title:NTFS ReFS Filesystems Only
    Description:Local volumes must use a format that supports NTFS attributes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.) (negated)
      • false (Verifies local volumes are formatted using NTFS or ReFS)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:102400 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Verifies local volumes are formatted using NTFS or ReFS
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:102400 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT filesystem FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!='NTFS' AND filesystem!='ReFS''
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ not evaluated ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT filesystem FROM win32_logicaldisk WHERE drivetype=3 AND filesystem!='NTFS' AND filesystem!='ReFS''
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-224874 - Windows Server 2016 reversible password encryption must be disabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224874r877397_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000090
    Identities:V-73325
    SV-87977
    CCI-000196 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (c); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (c))
    Description: Storing passwords using reversible encryption is essentially the same as storing clear-text versions of the passwords, which are easily compromised. For this reason, this policy must never be enabled.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Store passwords using reversible encryption" to "Disabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1019
    Result:true
    Title:Reversible Password Encryption
    Description:Reversible password encryption must be disabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101900 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Store password using reversible encryption' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101500 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101900 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', reversible_encryption, the following must be true:
      • reversible_encryption must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-224932 - AutoPlay must be turned off for non-volume devices.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224932r852325_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-CC-000250
    Identities:SV-88209
    V-73545
    CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. This setting will disable AutoPlay for non-volume devices, such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1097
    Result:false
    Title:WN16-CC-000250
    Description:Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false ('Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:109700 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:109700 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoAutoplayfornonVolume'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:109700 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
      • value must be equal to '1'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-224934 - AutoPlay must be disabled for all drives.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224934r852327_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-CC-000270
    Identities:SV-88213
    V-73549
    CCI-001764 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 (2); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 (2))
    Description: Allowing AutoPlay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system. AutoPlay begins reading from a drive as soon media is inserted into the drive. As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start. By default, AutoPlay is disabled on removable drives, such as the floppy disk drive (but not the CD-ROM drive) and on network drives. Enabling this policy disables AutoPlay on all drives.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> AutoPlay Policies >> "Turn off AutoPlay" to "Enabled" with "All Drives" selected.
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1099
    Result:true
    Title:WN16-CC-000270
    Description:Autoplay must be disabled for all drives.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled' with 'All Drives' selected)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:109900 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Turn off AutoPlay' is set to 'Enabled' with 'All Drives' selected
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:109900 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name must be equal to 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:109900 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '255'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer'
    • name equals 'NoDriveTypeAutoRun'
    • last_write_time equals '133409749610000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '255'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224958r877395_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-CC-000500
    Identities:V-73593
    SV-88257

    Description: Basic authentication uses plain-text passwords that could be used to compromise a system. Disabling Basic authentication will reduce this potential.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Windows Remote Management (WinRM) >> WinRM Client >> "Allow Basic authentication" to "Disabled".

    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:112600 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\WinRM\Service'
    • name must be equal to 'AllowBasic'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:112600 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.

    V-225025 - Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-225025r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-SO-000020
    Identities:SV-88285
    V-73621
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: An account without a password can allow unauthorized access to a system as only the username would be required. Password policies should prevent accounts with blank passwords from existing on a system. However, if a local account with a blank password does exist, enabling this setting will prevent network access, limiting the account to local console logon only.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1184
    Result:true
    Title:Limit Blank Passwords
    Description:Local accounts with blank passwords must be restricted to prevent access from the network.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:118400 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Accounts: Limit local account use of blank passwords to console logon only' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:118400 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentcontrolSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal to 'LimitBlankPasswordUse'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:118400 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • for check = 'all', value, the following must be true:
      • value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentcontrolSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'LimitBlankPasswordUse'
    • last_write_time equals '133415425150000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-225044 - Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-225044r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-SO-000250
    Identities:SV-88329
    V-73665
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Allowing anonymous SID/Name translation can provide sensitive information for accessing a system. Only authorized users must be able to perform such translations.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation" to "Disabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:

    Result:true

    Description:Anonymous SID/Name translation must not be allowed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation is set to 'Disabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:4481 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Network access: Allow anonymous SID/Name translation is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:4481 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:4481 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', anonymous_name_lookup must be equal to '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-225045 - Anonymous enumeration of Security Account Manager (SAM) accounts must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-225045r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-SO-000260
    Identities:SV-88331
    V-73667
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous logon users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts" to "Enabled".
    Severity:high
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1205
    Result:true
    Title:Restrict Anonymous SAM Enumeration
    Description:Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:120500 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:120500 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name must be equal to 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:120500 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa'
    • name equals 'RestrictAnonymousSAM'
    • last_write_time equals '133415425150000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-225046 - Anonymous enumeration of shares must not be allowed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-225046r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-SO-000270
    Identities:SV-88333
    V-73669
    CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Allowing anonymous logon users (null session connections) to list all account names and enumerate all shared resources can provide a map of potential points to attack the system.

    V-225048 - Anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares must be restricted.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-225048r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-SO-000300
    Identities:SV-88339
    V-73675
    CCI-001090 (NIST SP 800-53: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53A: SC-4.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: SC-4; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SC-4)
    Description: Allowing anonymous access to named pipes or shares provides the potential for unauthorized system access. This setting restricts access to those defined in "Network access: Named Pipes that can be accessed anonymously" and "Network access: Shares that can be accessed anonymously", both of which must be blank under other requirements.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> "Network access: Restrict anonymous access to Named Pipes and Shares" to "Enabled".
