    V-224856 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be uninstalled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224856r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-00-000410
    Identities:V-73299
    SV-87951
    CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks and is not FIPS compliant.
    Fix Text:Uninstall the SMBv1 protocol.

    Open "Windows PowerShell" with elevated privileges (run as administrator).

    Enter "Uninstall-WindowsFeature -Name FS-SMB1 -Restart".
    (Omit the Restart parameter if an immediate restart of the system cannot be done.)

    Alternately:

    Start "Server Manager".

    Select the server with the feature.

    Scroll down to "ROLES AND FEATURES" in the right pane.

    Select "Remove Roles and Features" from the drop-down "TASKS" list.

    Select the appropriate server on the "Server Selection" page and click "Next".

    Deselect "SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support" on the "Features" page.

    Click "Next" and "Remove" as prompted.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1259
    Result:false
    Title:WN16-00-000410
    Description:The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be uninstalled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • false ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16900 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16900 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16900 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17000 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name must be equal to 'Start'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name equals 'Start'
    • last_write_time equals '131241891640000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '2'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    value
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16800 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16800 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16800 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '1'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-224857 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224857r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-00-000411
    Identities:V-78123
    SV-92829
    CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 Server" to "Disabled".

    The system must be restarted for the change to take effect.

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1260
    Result:false
    Title:WN16-00-000411
    Description:The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB server.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled')
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16900 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 Server' is set to 'Disabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16900 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\LanmanServer\Parameters'
    • name must be equal to 'SMB1'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16900 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '0'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16800 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16800 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16800 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '1'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-224858 - The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224858r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-00-000412
    Identities:V-78125
    SV-92831
    CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: SMBv1 is a legacy protocol that uses the MD5 algorithm as part of SMB. MD5 is known to be vulnerable to a number of attacks such as collision and preimage attacks as well as not being FIPS compliant.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> MS Security Guide >> "Configure SMBv1 client driver" to "Enabled" with "Disable driver (recommended)" selected for "Configure MrxSmb10 driver".

    The system must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

    This policy setting requires the installation of the SecGuide custom templates included with the STIG package. "SecGuide.admx" and "SecGuide.adml" must be copied to the \Windows\PolicyDefinitions and \Windows\PolicyDefinitions\en-US directories respectively.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1261
    Result:false
    Title:WN16-00-000412
    Description:The Server Message Block (SMB) v1 protocol must be disabled on the SMB client.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver')
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:17000 (registry_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Configure SMBv1 client driver' is set to 'Enabled' with 'Disable driver (recommended)' selected for 'Configure MrxSmb10 driver'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:17000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name must be equal to 'Start'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:17000 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', type must be equal to 'reg_dword'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '4'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\mrxsmb10'
    • name equals 'Start'
    • last_write_time equals '131241891640000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '2'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    value
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:16800 (wmi57_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'SMB 1.0/CIFS File Sharing Support' feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:16800 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:16800 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • at least one installstate must be equal to '2'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT installstate FROM win32_optionalfeature WHERE name = 'SMB1Protocol''
    • collected 'result' result:
      • installstate = '1'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    result

    V-224859 - Windows PowerShell 2.0 must not be installed.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224859r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-00-000420
    Identities:SV-87953
    V-73301
    CCI-000381 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-7; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-7 a)
    Description: Windows PowerShell 5.0 added advanced logging features that can provide additional detail when malware has been run on a system. Disabling the Windows PowerShell 2.0 mitigates against a downgrade attack that evades the Windows PowerShell 5.0 script block logging feature.
    Fix Text:Uninstall the "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine".

    Start "Server Manager".

    Select the server with the feature.

    Scroll down to "ROLES AND FEATURES" in the right pane.

    Select "Remove Roles and Features" from the drop-down "TASKS" list.

    Select the appropriate server on the "Server Selection" page and click "Next".

    Deselect "Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine" under "Windows PowerShell" on the "Features" page.

    Click "Next" and "Remove" as prompted.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1266
    Result:true
    Title:WN16-00-000420
    Description:Windows PowerShell 2.0 must not be installed.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine server feature is not installed)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:126600 (wmi57_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Windows PowerShell 2.0 Engine server feature is not installed
    Check Existence:All collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:126500 (wmi57_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • namespace must be equal to 'root\cimv2'
    • wql must be equal to 'SELECT id FROM win32_serverfeature'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:126600 (wmi57_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'result' the following must be true:
      • no id must be equal to '411'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • namespace equals 'root\cimv2'
    • wql equals 'SELECT id FROM win32_serverfeature'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '6'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '481'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '255'
    • collected 'result' result:
      • id = '487'

    • collected 'result' result:

    V-224860 - FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224860r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-00-000430
    Identities:SV-87955
    V-73303
    CCI-000366 (NIST SP 800-53: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53A: CM-6.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: CM-6 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: CM-6 b)
    Description: The FTP service allows remote users to access shared files and directories. Allowing anonymous FTP connections makes user auditing difficult.

    Using accounts that have administrator privileges to log on to FTP risks that the userid and password will be captured on the network and give administrator access to an unauthorized user.
    Fix Text:Configure the FTP service to prevent anonymous logons.

    Open "Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager".

    Select the server.

    Double-click "FTP Authentication".

    Select "Anonymous Authentication".

    Select "Disabled" under "Actions".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:def:821
    Result:true
    Title:SRG-OS-000480-GPOS-00227, SV-224860r569186
    Description:FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
      • not applicable (FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.)
      • true (If FTP is not installed on the system, this is NA.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:821 (appcmdlistconfig_test)
    Result:not applicable
    Title:FTP servers must be configured to prevent anonymous logons.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:821 (appcmdlistconfig_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • identifier_type must be equal to 'Site'
    • identifier must match the pattern '.*'
    • section must be equal to 'system.applicationHost/sites'
    • parameter must be equal to 'siteDefaults.ftpServer.security.authentication.anonymousAuthentication.enabled'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:821 (appcmdlistconfig_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', result must be equal to 'false'
    Additional Information:Check existence requirement not met.
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:822 (cmdlet_test)
    Result:true
    Title:If FTP is not installed on the system, this is NA.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:822 (cmdlet_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • module_name must be equal to 'Microsoft.Powershell.Management'
    • verb must be equal to 'Get'
    • noun must be equal to 'WindowsFeature'
    • for 'parameters' the following must be true:
      • name must be equal to 'Web-FTP-Server'
    • for 'select' the following must be true:
      • property must be equal to 'installstate'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:822 (cmdlet_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for all 'value' the following must be true:
      • all installstate must not be equal (case insensitive) to 'installed'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • module_name equals 'Microsoft.PowerShell.Management'
    • module_id equals '{eefcb906-b326-4e99-9f54-8b4bb6ef3c6d}'
    • module_version equals '3.1.0.0'
    • verb equals 'Get'
    • noun equals 'WindowsFeature'
    • collected 'parameters' result:
      • name = 'Web-FTP-Server'
    • collected 'select' result:
      • property = 'installstate'
    • collected 'value' result:
      • installstate = 'Available'

    V-224866 - Windows 2016 account lockout duration must be configured to 15 minutes or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224866r852301_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000010
    Identities:SV-87961
    V-73309
    CCI-002238 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 b)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that an account will remain locked after the specified number of failed logon attempts.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout duration" to "15" minutes or greater.

    A value of "0" is also acceptable, requiring an administrator to unlock the account.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1011
    Result:true
    Title:Lockout Duration
    Description:Lockout duration must meet minimum requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Account lockout duration' is set to '0')
      • true ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101100 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout duration' is set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    State Operator:One or more item-state comparisons may be true.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101100 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be less than or equal to '0'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101101 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be equal to '4294967295'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101102 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_duration must be greater than or equal to '900'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '0'
    • lockout_duration equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '10'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101201 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101201 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '0'
    • lockout_duration equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '10'

    V-224867 - Windows Server 2016 must have the number of allowed bad logon attempts configured to three or less.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224867r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AC-000020
    Identities:SV-87963
    V-73311
    CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 a)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. The higher this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system. The number of bad logon attempts must be reasonably small to minimize the possibility of a successful password attack while allowing for honest errors made during normal user logon.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Account lockout threshold" to "3" or fewer invalid logon attempts (excluding "0", which is unacceptable).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1012
    Result:false
    Title:Bad Logon Attempts
    Description:The number of allowed bad logon attempts must meet minimum requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false ('Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less)
      • true ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101200 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is set to '3' or less
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101200 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', lockout_threshold, the following must be true:
      • lockout_threshold must be less than or equal to '3'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • force_logoff equals '0'
    • lockout_duration equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '10'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    lockout_threshold
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101201 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101201 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '0'
    • lockout_duration equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '10'

    V-224868 - Windows Server 2016 must have the period of time before the bad logon counter is reset configured to 15 minutes or greater.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224868r852302_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000030
    Identities:SV-87965
    V-73313
    CCI-000044 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53A: AC-7.1 (ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 a; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 a)
    CCI-002238 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-7 b; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-7 b)
    Description: The account lockout feature, when enabled, prevents brute-force password attacks on the system. This parameter specifies the period of time that must pass after failed logon attempts before the counter is reset to "0". The smaller this value is, the less effective the account lockout feature will be in protecting the local system.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000021-GPOS-00005, SRG-OS-000329-GPOS-00128
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Account Lockout Policy >> "Reset account lockout counter after" to at least "15" minutes.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1013
    Result:true
    Title:Bad Logon Counter Reset
    Description:The time before the bad-logon counter is reset must meet minimum requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least '15' minutes)
      • true ('Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101300 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Reset account lockout counter after' is set to at least '15' minutes
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101300 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', lockout_observation_window, the following must be true:
      • lockout_observation_window must be greater than or equal to '900'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • force_logoff equals '0'
    • lockout_duration equals '4294967295'
    • lockout_observation_window equals '1800'
    • lockout_threshold equals '10'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101201 (lockoutpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Account lockout threshold' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101200 (lockoutpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101201 (lockoutpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', lockout_threshold must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:

    • lockout_duration equals '4294967295'

    • lockout_threshold equals '10'

    V-224869 - Windows Server 2016 password history must be configured to 24 passwords remembered.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224869r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000040
    Identities:V-73315
    SV-87967
    CCI-000200 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (e); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (e))
    Description: A system is more vulnerable to unauthorized access when system users recycle the same password several times without being required to change to a unique password on a regularly scheduled basis. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes. The default value is "24" for Windows domain systems. DoD has decided this is the appropriate value for all Windows systems.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Enforce password history" to "24" passwords remembered.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1014
    Result:true
    Title:Password Uniqueness
    Description:Password uniqueness must meet minimum requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101400 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Enforce password history' is set to '24' passwords or more
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101500 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101400 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', password_hist_len, the following must be true:
      • password_hist_len must be greater than or equal to '24'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-224870 - Windows Server 2016 maximum password age must be configured to 60 days or less.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224870r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000050
    Identities:SV-87969
    V-73317
    CCI-000199 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: The longer a password is in use, the greater the opportunity for someone to gain unauthorized knowledge of the passwords. Scheduled changing of passwords hinders the ability of unauthorized system users to crack passwords and gain access to a system.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Maximum password age" to "60" days or less (excluding "0", which is unacceptable).
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1015
    Result:true
    Title:Maximum Password Age
    Description:Maximum password age must meet minimum requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Maximum Password Age' is set to '60' days or less)
      • true ('Maximum Password Age' is not set to '0')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101500 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Maximum Password Age' is set to '60' days or less
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101500 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101500 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', max_passwd_age, the following must be true:
      • max_passwd_age must be less than or equal to '5184000'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101501 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Maximum Password Age' is not set to '0'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101500 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101501 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', max_passwd_age must be greater than '0'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-224871 - Windows Server 2016 minimum password age must be configured to at least one day.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224871r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000060
    Identities:V-73319
    SV-87971
    CCI-000198 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (d); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (d))
    Description: Permitting passwords to be changed in immediate succession within the same day allows users to cycle passwords through their history database. This enables users to effectively negate the purpose of mandating periodic password changes.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum password age" to at least "1" day.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1016
    Result:true
    Title:Minimum Password Age
    Description:The minimum password age must meet requirements.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101600 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Minimum Password Age' is set to at least '1' day
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101500 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101600 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', min_passwd_age, the following must be true:
      • min_passwd_age must be greater than or equal to '86400'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-224872 - Windows Server 2016 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224872r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AC-000070
    Identities:V-73321
    SV-87973
    CCI-000205 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (i); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    Description: Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Minimum password length" to "14" characters.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2016:def:224872
    Result:false
    Title:WN16-AC-000070 - Windows Server 2016 minimum password length must be configured to 14 characters.
    Description:Information systems not protected with strong password schemes (including passwords of minimum length) provide the opportunity for anyone to crack the password, thus gaining access to the system and compromising the device, information, or the local network.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (All child checks must be true.)
        • false ('Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25330300 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:false
    Title:'Minimum password length' is set to at least '14' characters
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:20000002 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25330300 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', min_passwd_len must be greater than or equal to '14'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'
    Additional Information:Check requirement not met.
    min_passwd_len

    V-224873 - Windows Server 2016 must have the built-in Windows password complexity policy enabled.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224873r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AC-000080
    Identities:SV-87975
    V-73323
    CCI-000192 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    CCI-000193 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    CCI-000194 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    CCI-001619 (NIST SP 800-53: IA-5 (1) (a); NIST SP 800-53A: IA-5 (1).1 (v); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: IA-5 (1) (a))
    Description: The use of complex passwords increases their strength against attack. The built-in Windows password complexity policy requires passwords to contain at least three of the four types of characters (numbers, upper- and lower-case letters, and special characters) and prevents the inclusion of user names or parts of user names.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000069-GPOS-00037, SRG-OS-000070-GPOS-00038, SRG-OS-000071-GPOS-00039, SRG-OS-000266-GPOS-00101
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Account Policies >> Password Policy >> "Password must meet complexity requirements" to "Enabled".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1018
    Result:true
    Title:Microsoft Strong Password Filtering
    Description:The built-in Microsoft password complexity filter must be enabled.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true ('Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled')
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:tst:101800 (passwordpolicy_test)
    Result:true
    Title:'Password must meet complexity requirements' is set to 'Enabled'
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:obj:101500 (passwordpolicy_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:ste:101800 (passwordpolicy_state)
    State Requirements:
    • for check = 'all', password_complexity, the following must be true:
      • password_complexity must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • max_passwd_age equals '3888000'
    • min_passwd_age equals '432000'
    • min_passwd_len equals '8'
    • password_hist_len equals '24'
    • password_complexity equals '1'
    • reversible_encryption equals '0'
    • anonymous_name_lookup equals '0'

    V-224877 - Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224877r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AU-000030
    Identities:V-73405
    SV-88057
    CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the Application event log file (Application.evtx) to prevent access by non-privileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\ System32\winevt\Logs" folder.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2016:def:224877
    Result:true
    Title:WN16-AU-000030 - Permissions for the Application event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Application event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429601 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429601 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334002 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334002 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
    • name must be equal to 'file'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000016 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^(?i)%SystemRoot%.*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\Application'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133426390850000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\Windows\system32\winevt\Logs\Application.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429600 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The Application event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429600 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'

    V-224878 - Permissions for the Security event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224878r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AU-000040
    Identities:V-73407
    SV-88059
    CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the Security event log file (Security.evtx) to prevent access by non-privileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\ System32\winevt\Logs" folder.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0

The Security event log may disclose sensitive information or be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The Security event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The Security event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429701 (fileeffectiverights53_test)

    V-224879 - Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224879r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AU-000050
    Identities:SV-88061
    V-73409
    CCI-000162 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000163 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    CCI-000164 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9 a)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the System event log file (System.evtx) to prevent access by non-privileged accounts. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    Eventlog - Full Control
    SYSTEM - Full Control
    Administrators - Full Control

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\ System32\winevt\Logs" folder.

    If the location of the logs has been changed, when adding Eventlog to the permissions, it must be entered as "NT Service\Eventlog".
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2016:def:224879
    Result:true
    Title:WN16-AU-000050 - Permissions for the System event log must prevent access by non-privileged accounts.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. The System event log may be susceptible to tampering if proper permissions are not applied.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000057-GPOS-00027, SRG-OS-000058-GPOS-00028, SRG-OS-000059-GPOS-00029
    Class:compliance

    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path)
          • false (The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.) (negated)
        • true (All child checks must be true.)
          • true (The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path)
          • true (The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429801 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log must have at least default permissions. Strict Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429801 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25334202 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log registry specified location must have the %SystemRoot% environment variable.
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25334202 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System'
    • name must be equal to 'file'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:20000016 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must match the pattern '^(?i)%SystemRoot%.*$'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\EventLog\System'
    • name equals 'file'
    • last_write_time equals '133421145150000000'
    • type equals 'reg_expand_sz'
    • value equals '%SystemRoot%\system32\winevt\Logs\System.evtx'
    • expanded_value equals 'C:\Windows\system32\winevt\Logs\System.evtx'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429800 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:The System event log must have at least default permissions. Built Path
    Check Existence:No collected items may exist.
    Check:Result is based on check existence only.
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429800 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-880578595-1860270145-482643319-2788375705-1540778122'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-18'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544'
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-19'

    V-224880 - Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224880r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Pass
    Version:WN16-AU-000060
    Identities:SV-88063
    V-73411
    CCI-001494 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9)
    CCI-001495 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-9.1; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-9; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-9)
    Description: Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.

    Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys in order to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000258-GPOS-00099
    Fix Text:Configure the permissions on the "Eventvwr.exe" file to prevent modification by any groups or accounts other than TrustedInstaller. The default permissions listed below satisfy this requirement:

    TrustedInstaller - Full Control
    Administrators, SYSTEM, Users, ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES, ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES - Read & Execute

    The default location is the "%SystemRoot%\ System32" folder.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows2016:def:224880
    Result:true
    Title:WN16-AU-000060 - Event Viewer must be protected from unauthorized modification and deletion.
    Description:Protecting audit information also includes identifying and protecting the tools used to view and manipulate log data. Therefore, protecting audit tools is necessary to prevent unauthorized operation on audit information.

    Operating systems providing tools to interface with audit information will leverage user permissions and roles identifying the user accessing the tools and the corresponding rights the user enjoys in order to make access decisions regarding the modification or deletion of audit tools.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000257-GPOS-00098, SRG-OS-000258-GPOS-00099
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • true (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (All child checks must be true.)
        • true (Eventvwr.exe: Only Read and Execute rights for users other than TrustedInstaller)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:tst:25429900 (fileeffectiverights53_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Eventvwr.exe: Only Read and Execute rights for users other than TrustedInstaller
    Check Existence:Zero or more collected items may exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:obj:25429903 (fileeffectiverights53_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    Exclude Items If:
    • trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-80-956008885-3418522649-1831038044-1853292631-2271478464'
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.win:ste:25429901 (fileeffectiverights53_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', standard_delete must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', standard_write_dac must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', standard_write_owner must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', generic_write must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_write_data must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_append_data must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_write_ea must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_delete_child must be equal to 'false'
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', file_write_attributes must be equal to 'false'

    V-224881 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224881r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000070
    Identities:SV-88065
    V-73413
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Credential Validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Logon >> "Audit Credential Validation" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1055
    Result:false
    Title:Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.
    Description:Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Audit - Credential Validation - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Credential Validation - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:466400 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Audit - Credential Validation - Success only
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:All collected items must match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:obj:466400 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • Collect any available items.
    State ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:ste:466400 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', credential_validation must be equal to 'AUDIT_SUCCESS'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ false ]
    • credential_validation equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • kerberos_authentication_service equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    V-224882 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224882r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000080
    Identities:SV-88067
    V-73415

Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    V-224883 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224883r852305_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000100
    Identities:SV-88071
    V-73419
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Other Account Management Events records events such as the access of a password hash or the Password Policy Checking API being called.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000064-GPOS-00033, SRG-OS-000462-GPOS-00206, SRG-OS-000466-GPOS-00210
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit Other Account Management Events" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1057
    Result:false
    Title:Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.
    Description:The system must be configured to audit Account Management - Other Account Management Events successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Audit - Other Account Management Events - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Other Account Management Events - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:466800 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)

    V-224884 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - Security Group Management successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224884r852306_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000120
    Identities:SV-88075
    V-73423
    CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Security Group Management records events such as creating, deleting, or changing security groups, including changes in group members.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit Security Group Management" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:

    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:

    • mpssvc_rule_level_policy_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_policy_change_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • non_sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_privilege_use_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • sensitive_privilege_use equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • ipsec_driver equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • other_system_events equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • security_state_change equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • security_system_extension equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • system_integrity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • group_membership equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • pnp_activity equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • user_device_claims equals 'AUDIT_NONE'
    • audit_detailedtracking_tokenrightadjusted equals 'AUDIT_NONE'

    security_group_management

    V-224885 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Account Management - User Account Management successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224885r852307_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000140
    Identities:SV-88079
    V-73427
    CCI-000018 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-001403 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001404 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-001405 (NIST SP 800-53: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53A: AC-2 (4).1 (i and ii); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    CCI-002130 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-2 (4); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-2 (4))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    User Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling user accounts.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000004-GPOS-00004, SRG-OS-000239-GPOS-00089, SRG-OS-000240-GPOS-00090, SRG-OS-000241-GPOS-00091, SRG-OS-000303-GPOS-00120, SRG-OS-000476-GPOS-00221
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Account Management >> "Audit User Account Management" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1061
    Result:false

    V-224887 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224887r569186_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000160
    Identities:SV-88083
    V-73431
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Plug and Play activity records events related to the successful connection of external devices.
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit PNP Activity" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:def:1361
    Result:false
    Title:SRG-OS-000474-GPOS-00219, SV-224887r569186
    Description:Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Plug and Play Events successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • true (Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled)
      • false (Detailed Tracking - PNP Activity successes.)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:tst:10000 (registry_test)
    Result:true
    Title:Audit: Force audit policy subcategory settings to override audit policy category settings must be set to Enabled
    Check Existence:One or more collected items must exist.
    Check:One and only one item may match the given state(s).
    Object ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:obj:10000 (registry_object)
    Object Requirements:
    • hive must be equal to 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key must be equal to 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name must be equal to 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    State ID:oval:navy.navwar.niwcatlantic.scc.windows:ste:921 (registry_state)
    State Requirements:
    • check_existence = 'at_least_one_exists', value must be equal to '1'
    Collected Item/State Result:
    [ true ]
    • hive equals 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE'
    • key equals 'System\CurrentControlSet\Control\LSA'
    • name equals 'SCENoApplyLegacyAuditPolicy'
    • last_write_time equals '133415425150000000'
    • type equals 'reg_dword'
    • value equals '1'
    • windows_view equals '64_bit'

    V-224888 - Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.

    Rule ID:xccdf_mil.disa.stig_rule_SV-224888r852309_rule
    Test Type:Automated
    Result:Fail
    Version:WN16-AU-000170
    Identities:SV-88085
    V-73433
    CCI-000172 (NIST SP 800-53: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53A: AU-12.1 (iv); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AU-12 c; NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AU-12 c)
    CCI-002234 (NIST SP 800-53 Rev 4: AC-6 (9); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: AC-6 (9))
    Description: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks. Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised. Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

    Process Creation records events related to the creation of a process and the source.

    Satisfies: SRG-OS-000327-GPOS-00127, SRG-OS-000471-GPOS-00215
    Fix Text:Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Detailed Tracking >> "Audit Process Creation" with "Success" selected.
    Severity:medium
    Weight:10.0
    Reference:
    Title:DPMS Target Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Publisher:DISA
    Type:DPMS Target
    Subject:Microsoft Windows Server 2016
    Identifier:4205
    Definitions:
    Definition ID:oval:mil.disa.stig.windows:def:1063
    Result:false
    Title:Windows Server 2016 must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.
    Description:The system must be configured to audit Detailed Tracking - Process Creation successes.
    Class:compliance
    Tests:
    • false (All child checks must be true.)
      • false (One or more child checks must be true.)
        • false (Audit - Process Creation - Success only)
        • false (Audit - Process Creation - Success and Failure)
    Tests:
    Test ID:oval:mil.disa.fso.windows:tst:467400 (auditeventpolicysubcategories_test)
    Result:false
    Title:Audit - Process Creation - Success only
